info.name: MRX API TESTING
info.description:
This is the API of MRX Systems.

It allows you to interact with the MRX systems.

## Authentication
To authenticate, use the **POST /auth/login** route with the following body:
```json
{
    "email": "youremail@example.com",
    "password": "yourpassword"
}
```
After a successful login, you will receive a token in the response body (`content.access_token`).

Use this token in the **Authorization** header with the **Bearer** prefix to access the protected routes.

## Permissions
Permissions are used to control access to different routes in the application.

Each user has specific permissions for each selected database during their requests.

Examples:

- Database1: `['profile.all', 'example.all']`.
- Database2: `['profile.all', 'example.read']`.

## Permissions Structure
- Permissions are structured in the format: `[module].[action]`.

## Actions
- **all**: Allows access to all resources.
- **read**: Allows reading resources.
- **create**: Allows creating resources.
- **update**: Allows updating resources.
- **delete**: Allows deleting resources.

## Contact
If you have any questions or suggestions, feel free to contact us.
- **Email**: [contact@mrxsys.com](mailto:contact@mrxsys.com)
---

*MRX Systems Â© 2024*


Contact Support:
 Name: MRX Systems
 Email: contact@mrxsys.com

exec: // Define the login request details (URL, method, headers, and body)
method: 'POST',  // HTTP method to be used (POST for login)
header: 'Content-Type:application/json',  // Set the header content type to JSON
raw: JSON.stringify({  // Request body containing email and password
// Check if the bearer token is already present in the environment
if (!bearerToken) {  // If the token is missing
// Send the login request to get a new token
pm.sendRequest(loginRequest, function (err, res) {  // Send the login request
// Add a custom header for the database being used in the request
value: 'beDemo1_dev'  // Value indicating the specific database (e.g., 'beDemo1_dev')
